title: Single slit - new fringe spacing - width is 1-3rd

content.question: Light passes through a single narrow opening of width <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>, resulting in a pattern of bright and dark fringes on a screen across from the opening. The distance between adjacent dark fringes in the pattern is <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>. The opening is then replaced with one of width <math alttext="the fraction with numerator a and denominator 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>. What is the distance between adjacent dark fringes in the pattern formed with the second, narrower opening?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
